paperparcel

Annotation Type PaperParcel.Options


  • @Documented
 @Retention(value=SOURCE)
 @Target(value={ANNOTATION_TYPE,TYPE})
public static @interface PaperParcel.Options

    Options for configuring how the PaperParcelProcessor should handle parsing @PaperParcel classes.

    This annotation can be applied directly to an PaperParcel-annotated class like so: 

    
  @PaperParcel.Options(...)
  @PaperParcel
  public final class User implements Parcelable {
    String username;
    String password;
    // ...
  }

    Defining Options in this manner can become tedious if you want to apply the same options to many of your model objects. For a more reusable strategy, you may wish to create a custom annotation which will define all of the rules you wish to apply; then use your custom annotation on your PaperParcel classes instead. Here's an example of a custom annotation that has Options applied to it: 

    
  @PaperParcel.Options(...)
  @Retention(RetentionPolicy.SOURCE)
  @Target(ElementType.TYPE)
  public @interface MyOptions {
  }

    Now MyOptions could be applied to any PaperParcel class to apply the rules associated with it: 

    
  @MyOptions
  @PaperParcel
  public final class User implements Parcelable {
    String username;
    String password;
    // ...
  }

    This annotation can also be applied globally via ProcessorConfig.options(). Note that any rules applied directly to a class will override the global rules.

    See Also:
    ProcessorConfig

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation>[] excludeAnnotations
      Configures PaperParcel to exclude any field that is annotated with any of the given annotations.
      int[] excludeModifiers
      Configures PaperParcel to exclude any field that has the given modifiers.
      boolean excludeNonExposedFields
      Configures PaperParcel to exclude all fields that are not annotated by one of the annotations returned by exposeAnnotations().
      java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation>[] exposeAnnotations
      Configures PaperParcel to only include fields that are annotated with any of the given annotations.
      java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation>[] reflectAnnotations
      Configures PaperParcel to be able to access private constructors and fields that are annotated with any of the given annotations (using reflection).

    • Element Detail

      • excludeAnnotations

        public abstract java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation>[] excludeAnnotations
        Configures PaperParcel to exclude any field that is annotated with any of the given annotations.
        Default:
        {}

      • exposeAnnotations

        public abstract java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation>[] exposeAnnotations

        Configures PaperParcel to only include fields that are annotated with any of the given annotations.

        This API only works when returning true from excludeNonExposedFields().

        See Also:
        excludeNonExposedFields()
        Default:
        {}

      • excludeNonExposedFields

        public abstract boolean excludeNonExposedFields
        Configures PaperParcel to exclude all fields that are not annotated by one of the annotations returned by exposeAnnotations(). This is useful in a style of programming where you want to explicitly specify all fields that should be considered for parcelling.
        See Also:
        exposeAnnotations()
        Default:
        false

      • excludeModifiers

        public abstract int[] excludeModifiers

        Configures PaperParcel to exclude any field that has the given modifiers. The int values returned by this method must be Modifier constants. Modifiers can be combined using the bitwise OR operator if you want to exclude specific combinations of modifiers.

        By default any transient or static field is excluded.

        Default:
        {128, 8}

      • reflectAnnotations

        public abstract java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation>[] reflectAnnotations

        Configures PaperParcel to be able to access private constructors and fields that are annotated with any of the given annotations (using reflection).

        Because reflection is slow on Android, this option should be used sparingly. Because of the performance implications, PaperParcel will always favor not using reflection when it is possible.

        Note: if your code will be obfuscated, be sure to retain the names of the annotated fields and constructors so that the generated reflection calls will continue to work.

        Default:
        {}
